Deficiency Narrative: The child's managing conservator stated he was not informed about the incident and found out about it when the child mentioned it to him. The PM, who is in charge of calling CPS stated he believed he had contacted the CPS worker but was not one hundred percent certain. The administrator stated the PM is the person who calls CPS as is required, but that unfortunately they don't have phone records of it occurring. Per the operation's policies and procedures, the facility will notify the caseworker as soon as possible but no later than 2 hours.
Correction Narrative: RCCR Supervisor received an email from Administrator Mitchell with the compliance plan. It states residents will be taken to the doctor as soon as any medical concerns are reported. In the event an incident occurs after business hours they will be taken to the Urgent Care or Emergency Room. Caseworker/managing conservator will be notified by Administration or Residential Manager when an incident occurs with a resident as soon as possible but no later than 24 hours.

Deficiency Narrative:
During a review conducted on October 14, 2024, it was determined that:

(1) your operations administrator failed to ensure compliance with the current HM Plan(s); and

(2) 12 months had elapsed since the effective date of the plan.

As you know, the heightened monitoring plans for your operation included a specific planned end date at the 12-month mark by which your operation was expected to meet all heightened monitoring criteria necessary to
move out of active heightened monitoring to a phase of post plan monitoring. As a direct result of the administrators failure to ensure timely compliance with heightened monitoring plans, your operation is now unable to successfully move to post-plan monitoring.

Furthermore, your operations planned end date must now be revised, and the period of heightened monitoring must be extended again. 

Further details of the failure of your operations administrator to ensure compliance include the following:

- Operation was unable to meet compliance with Medium-High or High weighted licensing citations, including having an open investigation(s).

Finding: 748.535(2)  The licensed administrator must ensure the operation complies with current heightened monitoring plans.
Correction Narrative: An HM extension was approved effective 10/14/2024.  In conjunction with this extension, a new deadline was established by which all requirements must be completed by your GRO in order for the operation to be released from its HM plan and move to the Post-plan Monitoring Stage of HM.  Because the extended deadline is now effective, HHSC has determined that the operation is compliant with the requirements of 26 TAC 748.535(2).  The HM deadline for your operation has been extended by 6 months and the new deadline is 4/15/2025.

Deficiency Narrative:
During a review conducted on April 12, 2024, it was determined that: 
(1)	your operations administrator failed to ensure compliance with the current HM Plan(s); and 
(2)	more than 12 months had elapsed since the effective date of the plan.
As you know, the heightened monitoring plans for your operation included a specific planned end date at the original 12-month mark by which your operation was expected to meet all heightened monitoring criteria necessary to move out of active heightened monitoring to a phase of post plan monitoring.  As a direct result of the administrators failure to ensure timely compliance with heightened monitoring plans, your operation was unable to successfully move to post-plan monitoring by the original planned end date necessitating previous extension. Furthermore, due to your recent citation issued on September 26, 2023, your operations planned end date must now be revised again, and the period of heightened monitoring must be extended again. 
Further details of the administrators failure to ensure compliance include the following: 
Your operation received a high weighted citation in a pattern/trend category on December 4, 2023.  Specifically, the operation was cited for 748.2307(6) Other Prohibited Punishments-pinching, pulling hair, biting, or shaking a child. The operation met compliance on December 11, 2023.  
- Operation failed to demonstrate 6 months of successive compliance with the standard and contract requirements that led to heightened monitoring. 
- Operation was unable to meet compliance with Medium-High or High weighted licensing citations   
Finding: 748.535(2)  The licensed administrator must ensure the operation complies with current heightened monitoring plans.
Several children in care stated that they have been threatened by staff at the facility.
Correction Narrative:
Email received from Administrator Mitchell stating that Staff Meeting/Training scheduled for 4/24/24.  Administration will review with staff the Minimum Standard that was cited, review and provide a copy of the NHYC Childs Rights/TDFPS Childs Rights, as well as provide training to educate them on methods that are more effective in dealing with a child. 

Email sent on 04.25.2024 with sign in sheet for training provided on 04.24.2024

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough of the facility, one Green gallon of all purpose pinalen Fresh pine cleaner was observed  on top of counter next to the washing machine.
During the walkthrough of the facility several rotten pears were observed inside the fruit bowl in the kitchen counter. All rotten fruits were trashed by staff in my presence.

During a review conducted on October 11, 2023, it was determined that:

(1) your operations administrator failed to ensure compliance with the current HM Plan(s); and

(2) 12 months had elapsed since the effective date of the plan.

As you know, the heightened monitoring plans for your operation included a specific "planned end date at the

As a direct result of the administrators failure to ensure timely compliance with heightened monitoring plans, your operation was unable to successfully move to post-plan monitoring necessitating extension.  Furthermore, your operations planned end date must now be revised again, and the period of heightened monitoring must be extended again.  Further details of the failure of your operations administrator to ensure compliance include the following:

Your operation received a medium-low weighted citation in a pattern/trend category on September 26, 2023.  Specifically, the operation was cited for 748.1335 Initial Service Plan-Complete the initial service plan within 45 days after admission. The operation met compliance on September 26, 2023.

Correction Narrative: An HM extension was approved.  In conjunction with this extension, a new deadline was established by which all requirements must be completed by your CPA/GRO in order for the operation to be released from its HM plan and move to the Post-plan Monitoring Stage of HM. The HM deadline for your operation has been extended by 6 months and the new deadline is 4/12/24.

Deficiency Narrative: One child service plan was reviewed today. It was observed during the review of the plan that the child was admitted on 08-10-23 but initial service plan was completed on 9-25-23 which is 46 days. Agency staff stated that the initial servce plan was completed on 09-22-23 and not 9-25-23 as indicated in the plan but was not able to provide me with any evidence that the meeting was held on 9-22-23.
Correction Narrative: Written correction was sent via email today 9-26-23. In the correction, the operation stated that henceforth, they will be completing initial service plans within 45 days from date of child admission.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that a child grabbed a pair of scissors that were unattended from the kitchen counter and threatened to stab staff.
Correction Narrative: 2 staff were interviewed, and they confirmed that a meeting was held with administrator and that staff will ensure that all scissors are removed immediately residents finished using it as well as all other items that could be deemed unsafe.  The also confirmed that Administration/ Managers / Houseparent are doing walk through each shift to ensure that no unsafe items are left unattended. They also stated that Minimum Standard was reviewed with staff.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that staff was pinching a child's nose to get the child get off of him.
Correction Narrative: Follow up by inspection was completed. 2 staff were interviewed, and they confirmed a refresher course for EBI was held for all staff. The operation also sent a written correction, in its correction, it stated that a refresher course was held on EBI.  Copy of the refresher training certificate for 10-8-23 by a professional licensed trainer and photo was taken after approval.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that child was left outside unsupervised for about 10 to 15 minutes while staff was inside the facility.
Correction Narrative: 2 staff were interviewed, and they confirmed that a refresher course for Supervision was held to reiterate the importance of ensuring that staff on duty should be able to be accountable for resident's actions at all times. They stated that staff should be able to see what residents are doing at all times.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed during the walkthrough of the facility that the Air Conditioner in the Day room is leaking water from the unit to the ground. It appears the leak has been going on for some days which has resulted to some part of the wall appeared to be soaked from the leaking water from the A/C Unit.
Correction Narrative: It was observed during the walkthrough of the facility that the Air Conditioner in the Day room is leaking water from the unit to the ground. It appears the leak has been going on for some days which has resulted to some part of the wall appeared to be soaked from the leaking water from the A/C Unit.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed during the review of a childs file that the admission assessment form Part 1 has wrong date of admission for the child. Child correct date of admission was 6-16-23 but the date of admission in the admission assessment form Part 1 has 3-8-21. The Administrator corrected the information to reflect the correct date of admission which was 6-16-23.

During the review of a childs initial service plan, it was observed that the DOB for the child in the initial Service plan is different from the correct DOB which is in the childs DFPS placement authorization.
The administrator confirmed that the incident went on for several hours. Licensing was not made aware of the incident until the following day.
Correction Narrative: Follow up to assessment #269388. 2 serious incident reports were reviewed for 5-21-23 and 5-22-23, and no concern was observed. Also spoke with administrator regarding ensuring that staff reports SIR timely to the hotline.

Deficiency Narrative: Three out of five children interviewed stated a staff member calls them names.
Correction Narrative:
Written corrections were received by the operation. The operation stated that the staff that was involved in the standard violation was counseled by the Administrator as well as trained on the specific minimum standard that was violated. He received Sensitivity training on 4-27-23. Follow up inspection will be complete.

Deficiency Narrative: Four out of four EBI documentation reviewed did not document that the youth's parent was notified.
Correction Narrative: A copy of updated EBI form was emailed to show where   parent will be notified of EBI.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of four child records reviewed did not include an immunization record or documented attempts to obtain the record.
3 children stated that staff are sleeping while on shift. The operation currently has 11 children in care with one staff during overnight shift.
Correction Narrative:
Leadership emailed over corrective action on 1/31/2023 and stated that Administration will meet with each individual overnight staff to stress the importance and safety of them remaining awake and monitoring the residents during their shift. As well as Administration will review the Minimum standard with them that is affected. All discussions will happen by 2/3/2023. 

on 2/3/2023, leadership sent correction via email. All staff received supervision training and certificates were received. Leadership had a meeting with overnight staff to discuss the no sleeping policy and the signature page was sent via email.

Correction Narrative: The victim child and the Caregiver supervising the group stated the Caregiver had stepped away to help another resident when a physical altercation happened. No concerns regarding general supervision were reported.

Deficiency Narrative: Both the victim child and the Caregiver who performed a restraint, stated the child's arms was placed behind his back.
Correction Narrative: Follow-up was conducted by inspection. Children were interviewed and there were no concerns. Written corrections was sent to inspector via email that they will schedule restraint training and discipline with updated curriculum.

Deficiency Narrative: During walkthrough,  it was observed that a staff that is not counted in ratio was watching a group of children.

Staff member was overheard telling the resident that he was a liar and not credible. In the interview with staff member, staff member stated there was a pattern forming with the child having an attraction to his older roommates. Staff member even admits to bringing in the children and putting them against one another. However, he continued to put him with similar roommates, and failed to tell his therapist.
Correction Narrative:
All Administrative staff will document any conversatios
that are held with residents and with other individuals about residents, to ensure that nothing is misunderstood and to validate what was stated during the conversation. The document will be signed by resident (if applicable) as well as any other party that is present (if applicable). Documentation will be kept in Binders in the Administrative Offices.

Deficiency Narrative: Documentation shows a child was held in a prone position for 2 minutes.
Correction Narrative: The staff involved completed retraining for EBI.  The op conducted a staff meeting on May 20, 2022 and focused on EBI documentation; specific to, ensuring that the type of containment and length of time is also documented in the incident report.

Deficiency Narrative: It is determined that a child was found outside the home, close to the street with no supervision.
Correction Narrative: It is determined that a child was found outside the home, close to the street with no supervision.

Deficiency Narrative: Children that were interviewed stated that  a staff member talks to them rudely and at time uses profane language.

. All staff were re-trained on   subjecting a child to abusive or profane language and the standard.  
2. A suggestion box was ordered and will be made available upon arrival for residents to express their concern/complaints anonymously as well as any issues that they have.

Correction Narrative: The emergency evacuation & relocation diagrams observed do no include a designated shelter inside location nor an identified meeting place on the outside of the operation.

Correction Narrative: Most of the first aid kits were observed missing several of the required supplies such as: cotton balls, adhesive tape, and thermometers.

An email was received from the administrator stating the following: Administrator will conduct a Mandatory Emergency Staff Meeting on 3-15-22 to address this Citation.  Administrator will train/re-train staff on the importance of the standard and the ramification of not following the standard. Deficiency Narrative: Upon reviewing child's file, the TB test was missing from immunization list.

Deficiency Narrative: Two bottles of medication was observed in the staff room; not in the medication container where medication is kept.

Correction Narrative: The operation emailed a corrective action plan so that they are aware of what needs to be reported to liscensing.

Deficiency Narrative: Four of six children interviewed stated staff used profanity to or around them. Three of six children stated Supervisory Staff use abusive, profane and threatening language towards children in care.

Client interviews were conducted and three of three children denied being subjected to staff that were verbally degrading or using profanity. Staff were consulted about their participation in a staff meeting to discourage inappropriate language in the presence of children in care.  

An email was received from the administrator stating that a zoom staff meeting was held to address the minimum standard violation and discourage any further behaviors.

Deficiency Narrative: Two medication record logs were missing pills that are not accounted for. One Log has 20 pills listed but only 18 pills were found and the second log had 23 pills listed and only 22 pills accounted for.
Correction Narrative: An audit of the logs were conducted and it was found the pills were administered but was not documented. 1. medication error was form was completed. 2. Medication audits will be conducted twice weekly.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of three bathrooms contained no hand washing soap. Three of three bathrooms did not contain any approved hand drying agent.

Deficiency Narrative: One child record reviewed did not include the priliminary service plan.
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted via email the preliminary service plan.

Deficiency Narrative: A bed board was broken on the bottom bunk in bedroom 1 creating a risk to children in care.
Correction Narrative: The broken bed board was repaired on 4-20-21 by Maintenance.  Going forward New Hope Youth Center will continue to conduct Walk-Thru Inspections twice a week to ensure that all needed repairs are seen, documented and repaired in a timely manner.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation was observed to have a broken broken stove top.
Correction Narrative: A new stove top was installed on April 26, 2021.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed and photographed that the operation had loose bricks scattered throughout the property grounds in four (4) areas and a pile of damaged wood on the grounds.  At the front entrance, the porch light was observed to have damaged glass (outside). The front entrance outlet cover was observed to be damanged and have exposed metal area that needs to be replaced.
Correction Narrative: During follow up walkthrough on 4/1/21, it was observed that all the pieces of wood were picked up, the front lamp has been replaced, and the outlet has been covered. The bricks are needed to separate different areas of the property, such as the garden. The bricks are not a hazard to the children as the children are unable to pick up them.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that staff use profanity around children at the operation; which exposes residents to inappropriate language while in care.
Correction Narrative: There were interviews conducted at the operation and no concerns were noted.

Going forward during each 30 day THSTEPS exam, staff will rewquest that the Clinic perform a hearing exam.

Deficiency Narrative: There was no documentation on the EBI in the child's record at the operation.
Correction Narrative: Because Administration was unaware that a Containment had occurred no documentation was available to be placed in the EBI folder.  Our customary practice is that after an EBI has occurred Administration is notified, documentation is reviewed, signed off by Administrator and placed in the EBI folder.  This practice will continue. An unannounced inspection (INSP ID: 3820035) was conducted on 4/1

Deficiency Narrative: Staff have failed to intervene appropriately when they allowed children to horseplay which results in fighting and a child sustaining a non-serious laceration near the eyebrow.
Correction Narrative: An unannounced inspection (INSP ID: 3820035) was conducted on 4/1, and staff were observed in ratio supervising the children. Before Training Class began, Administrator reinforced to staff the seriousness of allowing residents to horseplay and what it could lead up to (i.e., altercations, etc) Staff were told to reframe from allowing the horseplay behavior to take place and to redirect the residents behavior.
